ok
This is a HTTP server, many proxies exist for cluster mode. No need to support

done
And this `Please rename fromSpanLayerValue to identifyRemoteServiceLayer.`.

done
the failed  ci check seems no relation with this commit?
The error is strange. Could you try to close this PR and open another one? I feel this is CI env issue.
ok
it is still failed, the error message is strange
This error usually means the docker-compose can't bootstrap. Could you try the docker image locally?

Notice, the UI template updates may be reset in the near future, as the 9.0.0 UI uses a different template structure.
Welcome back to recheck when it is ready on Mar.
ok

Then we need a way to build a labels(pool name) metric for connection pool. What do you want to build?
Could you provide more details?

now, in my projeject, agent core has a model contains pool name and thead threadPoolExecutor instance, the agent plugin set the thread pool name and instance to it on constructor, and the core get  message from the model, and send metrics to oap service
Could you share what do the OAL script, the new part of proto,  and UI look like?

This kind of filter function is very hard coded, and it has to set for all kinds of pools, which is not flexible, and have to set a lot of UI components to list all possibilities.
I am thinking whether we should treat this as a logic endpoint? And metrics reporting through meter API rather than JVM and OAL analysis.
@hanahmily We seem need a hot patch release.

emm, the agent plugin  and oap server is easy to add new thread pool,  the problem is how to display it in ui, i am not familiar with what you say, this has some demo in skywalking projectï¼Œor, we can make basic plugin to collect metirc and save it, every one can customizing their dashboard ui

For agent side, it is very similar to agent tracing plugin. Just calling different core APIs. Check this.

https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/skywalking-java/latest/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/java-plugin-development-guide/#meter-plugin

At the backend, you just need to learn meter receiver and MAL

1. https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/setup/backend/backend-meter/#manual-meter-api
2. Meter design, https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/concepts-and-designs/meter/
3. MAL, https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/concepts-and-designs/mal/

And learn fron slueth MAL setup
1. https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/setup/backend/spring-sleuth-setup/
2. Configuration file example, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/fc27f766c5da0f4165152025a6ba4080d034d1fc/oap-server/server-starter/src/main/resources/meter-analyzer-config/spring-sleuth.yaml
ok, i have a look

Before you do more integration, the metadata query DAO has re-implemented due to metadata-v2 query API accepted for SkyWalking v9.

Please sync the `banyandan-integration` branch from the master.
i have tried, it is okï¼Œplugin can give the  threadPoolExecutor instance,  and agent core build thread pool metrics, and send it to backend by meter api
It is good to know. Could you post the metric sample here? To make the further review easier?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22722907/149902103-ef7a634a-ea27-4f33-9244-2876363b0e2e.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22722907/149902167-b39e052e-b84f-4143-9890-8d5e50b27c4a.png)
I think we should use `labeled value`, which only requires one metric name in the MAL script. And UI's component title could be `Thread Pool`,  which could add more pool relative metrics easily.
Duplicated https://github.com/apache/skywalking/discussions/8443
i do not get your mean, there are many kinds of thread pool, every type thread pool can have a ui component, all in one seems strangeï¼Œand it is difficult to look
i think we can provide some base thread pool metric collect, like undertow, tomcat, other user can easy to add based on this way, and they can custom their own ui component

> i do not get your mean, there are many kinds of thread pool, every type thread pool can have a ui component, all in one seems strangeï¼Œand it is difficult to look

We don't have to set all thread pool metrics in one UI component. But `labeled value` could reduce the cost of the database resources. The way you are doing right now, is making one metric per database row. But labeled value could compress all types(queue size, pool size, max pool size) into one metric name.

```
undertow_thread_pool{pool_name="undertow_pool1",type="pool_size"} 10
undertow_thread_pool{pool_name="undertow_pool2",type="pool_size"} 15
undertow_thread_pool{pool_name="undertow_pool2",type="max_size"} 20
```

Then you just need one metric name on the UI, `undertow_thread_pool`.
you mean the agent report metric with same name and different tags by meter api ?
Yes. And AFAIK the MAL could land this one metric name with different tags in the storage.

yes, the oal config like  this in this wayï¼Œsame metric name with tag filter 


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22722907/149965925-0aa82fd8-a661-47e5-bd65-e1ec50cbdf33.png)

This config still could make the metrics into different metric name. I prefer we could do
```
metricsRules:
    - name: java_thread_pool
       exp: java_thread_pool
```
If you want to separate pools of Java, you could use  `undertow_thread_pool`. And types of `metric_type` is going to be available on the UI automatically as labels.

Coud you try this? @wankai123 could help if you face any issue.
i try, it not work, could you give some demo with ui template and oal config

Check K8s monitoring temple config. Or just put the metric name on UI setup mode page, and enter. It will tell you, it's a labeled value.
Don't use tag equal to split one metric into several.

This is a labeled value metrics visualized as a chart
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/150038471-10f7d54b-ef4d-4f52-b0fd-044ff525ffc8.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/150038517-d1bf2966-dc93-4a3e-9a30-3724e2fcdf04.png)

Project open sourced here, https://github.com/SphereEx/CyborgFlow
A CN blog posted, https://skywalking.apache.org/zh/2022-01-18-cyborg-flow/

If anyone needs this blog in English, please let us know, we are glad to translate. Generally, this feature is requested in China community.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22722907/150060150-d49e19a1-5dee-43de-9a12-10a39dafcc15.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22722907/150060306-3ff3f22f-df3f-40aa-9612-a3cf0b4e9c62.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22722907/150060215-5b38f6f6-8543-41fc-8f66-5e052b197cde.png)


yes, i config it in this way, but, it has no data in ui,  from the agent log, i can see meter report data 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22722907/150060733-95f7c695-f086-40e8-8d5b-84cbfaff1d3a.png)
Could you check what does the metric look like in the database?
And please provide the data in the MeterServiceHandler. Then we could know what is going on.
this is the data from MeterServiceHandlerï¼Œ the database is h2, i do not have tool to look
Could you put this in JSON format? And print it in the console, and provide us the rawdata? This debug screenshot is hard for us to know the details.

@wankai123 @mrproliu Could you take a look? I hope the final result keep `thread_pool` as metric name, and labels(undertow_worker_pool + max_pool_size) as the final label.

@xu1009 It is better you could use `H2` server mode to check the data, or ElasticSearch. Otherwise, it is hard for us to help this very detailed thing.
In the MAL, if you want to make it as labels metrics, need to add the  aggregate function on the metric. In this case, it should be thread_pool.avg(['pool_name', 'metrx_type', 'service']).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22722907/150095867-59abaa71-4b5d-405b-aea8-57e87b57a3d3.png)

it is not ok, the above image is data in database

The data looks good, what do you mean `not ok`?

Do you check the instance name(entity name in the table) and time bucket?

And, you could debug `MetricsQuery#readLabeledMetricsValues` to see what is going on. The logic is also not hard.
@hanahmily I'd like to do this.
@dashanji Thanks. I have assigned this to you, good luck.

> The es-init job complete correctly everytime

When we upgrade skywalking chart  the es-init job will run evenrytime ?
Why I use helm to upgrade skywalking es-init job not run

Please follow https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/8433 and finish local POC.
We prefer labeled value metrics rather than multiple metrics.

Once you did, please provide MAL script, UI configuration and UI preview here before submitting any pull request.

You need to follow that discussion. We prefer the final metrics as labeled values. Then you could list all metrics on the dashboard by using one metric name, which means we only need one row in the database per timebucket + entity.

Right now, if you have 10 metrics, then one service causes 10 rows in the database per timebucket.
@xu1009 Any update?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22722907/150175697-c3070ab7-65ad-40c6-a0bf-8546c33d04b3.png)

it is ok
Cool, good to see this. Let's move on to the official PR/Review to take care of code details. Thank you so much for your patience.

> You need to follow that discussion. We prefer the final metrics as labeled values. Then you could list all metrics on the dashboard by using one metric name, which means we only need one row in the database per timebucket + entity.
> 
> Right now, if you have 10 metrics, then one service causes 10 rows in the database per timebucket.

final metrics as labeled valuesï¼Œ. Now multiple data sources use this scheme. How to deal with multiple data sources in this way?

Reading the compiling doc. The git submodule is required.

I also encountered a similar problem, for the time being can only disable the plugin

@qiyue0421 You are different. From the log stack, it is clear you are using Jeager SDK, which we never tested. 
And why do you run 2 tracing cores at the same time? It could be a very complex scenario.
You are right, the developer feedback used jaeger sdk, maybe the previous technician testing jaeger (haha, I'm not too sure), currently using skywalking is better, sincerely thank you for your reply
All issues on GitHub must be in English.
All issues on GitHub must be in English.

Hold until https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/pull/95 merged.

Which language agent do you mean? Could you be more specific? All agent repositories accept pull requests to add a new plugin in the mainstream. You just need to follow all the tests and reviwers' comments.
I would like to help migrate the base docker images to `eclipse-temurin` ones.

@katelei6 Please keep in English if you want to GitHub discussion. Please translate above first.

I have an question:  we can see the infomation about trace in UI,  but the component infomation is  Unknownï¼Œ
but in  our python fileï¼š  __init__.pyï¼Œwe  set MysqlClient = 7013ï¼Œbut can not use this

I can see python mysql plugin is using `component_id=7003`, check here 

https://github.com/apache/skywalking-python/blob/d4e5ccd8b1e6d08a3c9eeb748ede8c99ff261895/skywalking/plugins/sw_pymysql.py?_pjax=%23js-repo-pjax-container%3Afirst-of-type%2C%20div%5Bitemtype%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fschema.org%2FSoftwareSourceCode%22%5D%20main%3Afirst-of-type%2C%20%5Bdata-pjax-container%5D%3Afirst-of-type#L40

The definition is from here, check the file and OAP version you are using.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/2c8504a3edbabb47fef6fcd1e3d2301688a09f72/oap-server/server-starter/src/main/resources/component-libraries.yml#L532-L534
if we develop the plugin support mysqlclient, this can we contruibute? beause in our project, we use mysqlclient instead of pymsql, so we develop this new plugin.
You could send a pull request to https://github.com/apache/skywalking-python, and add the required tests.
FYI @Fine0830 This should fix the missing `normal` status and missing catalog.

If you need MySQL component id, check the file I shared above. It should be `5`
```yaml
Mysql:
  id: 5
  languages: Java,C#,Node.js
```

And you need to send a pull request here to add Python in the `languages`.

Check your network. It is only a GitHub repo. It is as same as here.

FYI @mrproliu We added a new field in `listService` response in the protocol level. 

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/8463/commits/a7dd48c09c39b5b9095c91978a602e2fb23686fc

We need a CLI update.
apm-trace-ignore-plugin.config  I config the path like this: /actuator/**,/actuator,Redisson/**   Redisson can workï¼Œbut  /actuator/**, do not work!@wu-sheng

> This seems good. Do you have any suggestion or concern?

Is it better to add the function to the apm-agent-core module or create a new moduleï¼Ÿ
Is it reasonable to put mal analysis statements in the meter analyzer config directory?

> Is it better to add the function to the apm-agent-core module or create a new moduleï¼Ÿ

No, you don't. Meter or/and tracing have no difference to the agent core

> Is it reasonable to put mal analysis statements in the meter analyzer config directory?

Yes, it is. And mostly, I think you have to. Otherwise, you can't activate it through meter receiver.

@wankai123 @wu-sheng Shall we expose `isNormal` in `ServiceTraffic` with a `@Getter` annotation, since it is used to build the entity for the storage layer.

I guess it is missing.

> @wankai123 @wu-sheng Shall we expose `isNormal` in `ServiceTraffic` with a `@Getter` annotation, since it is used to build the entity for storage layer.
> 
> I guess it is missing.

@lujiajing1126 We don't persistent this field, it's just used to build `service_id` internal. We recommend to get this info from
`IDManager.ServiceIDDefinition.isreal`.
